metadata.name: Yellow Hair #1/3
metadata.description:
The blonde hair of their iconic dolls has often been a source of inspiration for artists. Especially during the pop art movement, artists such as Andy Warhol depicted iconic dolls in many different ways. For example, Warhol's reference to...

The colour and texture differences of blonde hair have also been captured in different ways by photographers and painters. For example, Richard Avedon's photographic series on the iconic dolls uses a bright and vibrant colour palette that emphasises the shimmer of blonde hair. Painters, on the other hand, have reflected the blonde hair of their iconic dolls using brushstrokes and layers of colour.

The iconic blonde-haired doll figure is recognised in artworks not only as an aesthetic feature but also as a cultural and social icon. With this feature, iconic dolls have an important symbolic value in works of art.
